intro: Phyllorkis thompsonii, commonly known as Thompson's phyllorkis, is a species of flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rainforest or wetland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
